value: aava_1.0_score
description

The two metadata versions represent the same conceptual workflow model with significant structural evolution. AAVA 2.0 introduces enhanced metadata organization and model versioning while preserving core semantic meaning. Major structural changes include workflow detail nesting and agent metadata enhancement.
Core workflow concept preserved: DI_DataSpecs_Modelupdates_SN workflow maintains identical business purpose across versions
Agent functional descriptions remain semantically identical with same business objectives and technical requirements
All three agents (Technical Specification, Delta Model Changes, Functional Test Cases) preserve their core responsibilities
Root structure reorganized: workflowId/workflowName flattened to nested workFlowDetail object with id/name properties
Agent container renamed from 'nodes' to 'workflowAgents' indicating semantic improvement in naming
Agent metadata structure significantly enhanced with agentId addition and modelDeploymentName specification
Tools reference mechanism changed from string array to empty toolReferences array structure
workflowId (1594) renamed to workFlowDetail.id (2147) with value change indicating version progression
workflowName renamed to workFlowDetail.name with identical semantic value
nodes array renamed to workflowAgents array for improved semantic clarity
agentName renamed to name within agent objects for consistency
model field renamed to modelDeploymentName with version upgrade from gpt-4 to gpt-4.1
Model version upgraded from 'gpt-4' to 'gpt-4.1' across all three agents indicating platform evolution
New agentId field introduced as numeric identifier (3885, 3474, 3545) for enhanced referential integrity
tools array replaced with empty toolReferences array, removing tool specification 'DI_Github_File_Writer_Z'
Tool references removed in AAVA 2.0 may impact workflow execution capabilities and dependency tracking
AAVA 1.0 demonstrates perfect JSON syntax validity with consistent object structure and proper nesting
All agent references maintain internal consistency with proper task and tool associations
AAVA 2.0 demonstrates perfect JSON syntax validity with enhanced structural organization
Agent ID references provide improved referential integrity compared to name-only identification
Evolution represents minor version upgrade with backward compatibility concerns due to structural changes
Field renaming pattern suggests systematic refactoring rather than ad-hoc changes
Structural changes may break existing parsers expecting flat workflow structure
Tool reference removal could impact workflow execution in systems dependent on tool specifications
Model version changes require validation of compatibility with existing deployment infrastructure
Empty toolReferences arrays unclear whether tools are deprecated or moved to different specification layer
Naming convention improvements: workFlowDetail vs workflowId/workflowName provides better semantic organization
Agent metadata enhancement with agentId provides foundation for improved workflow orchestration
Consistent description preservation across all agents maintains functional specification integrity
